nodes.bodyText: As discussed in the open-source meeting, let us use Alcor Thread pool if possible. Please refer to PR #424 for details.
It's only test code. And the original thread pool provides more flexibility.

Well. Which kinds of features are available in original thread pool but not in Alcor thread pool?
Meanwhile, we plan to make this more than test code :-)
Could we have a brief comment here to explain each method, as well as the map (e.g., what the key is)?
The map key is the Host IP, the value is Host ACA handled result statuses.
So DPM thread pool has a name :-)
In v2 NetworkConfiguration, could we get rid of rsType and OpType, which are supposed to be DPM internal and not part of the contract.
If we remove rsType and OpType, DPM should add more rest APIS to identity which resource and operation should update.

rsType and OpType are resource-level fields, not on the message level. That being said, there will be OpType inside each top-level resource. For example, router_internal always has field already, and we will add to more top-level resources.
Well, I think we can keep these two fields, and add OpType in top-level resources in the future.

Looks like supporting thread pool is something missing in our Alcor async executor. Could you evaluate with @chenpiaoping to see what need to add into our own executor.
Ideally we would like to replace it with our own implementation. I understand it may take some time but we will need to know what the gap is so that we could plan for it.
